verses.text: Thou also, son of man , take thee a tile , and lay it before thee, and pourtray upon it the city , \add even\add* Jerusalem :

And lay siege against it, and build a fort against it, and cast a mount against it; set the camp also against it, and set \add battering\add* rams against it round about.\f + \fr 4.2 \ft battering…: chief leaders\f*

Moreover take thou unto thee an iron pan , and set it \add for\add* a wall of iron between thee and the city : and set thy face against it, and it shall be besieged , and thou shalt lay siege against it. This \add shall be\add* a sign to the house of Israel.\f + \fr 4.3 \ft an…: or, a flat plate, or, slice\f*
Lie thou also upon thy left side , and lay the iniquity of the house of Israel upon it: \add according\add* to the number of the days that thou shalt lie upon it thou shalt bear their iniquity.
For I have laid upon thee the years of their iniquity , according to the number of the days , three hundred and ninety days : so shalt thou bear the iniquity of the house of Israel.

And when thou hast accomplished them , lie again on thy right side , and thou shalt bear the iniquity of the house of Judah forty days : I have appointed thee each day for a year.\f + \fr 4.6 \ft each…: Heb. a day for a year, a day for a year\f*
Therefore thou shalt set thy face toward the siege of Jerusalem , and thine arm \add shall be\add* uncovered , and thou shalt prophesy against it.

And, behold, I will lay bands upon thee, and thou shalt not turn thee from one side to another , till thou hast ended the days of thy siege.\f + \fr 4.8 \ft from one…: Heb. from thy side to thy side\f* \p

¶ Take thou also unto thee wheat , and barley , and beans , and lentiles , and millet , and fitches , and put them in one vessel , and make thee bread thereof, \add according\add* to the number of the days that thou shalt lie upon thy side , three hundred and ninety days shalt thou eat thereof.\f + \fr 4.9 \ft fitches: or, spelt\f*
And thy meat which thou shalt eat \add shall be\add* by weight , twenty shekels a day : from time to time shalt thou eat it.
Thou shalt drink also water by measure , the sixth part of an hin : from time to time shalt thou drink.
And thou shalt eat it \add as\add* barley cakes , and thou shalt bake it with dung that cometh out of man , in their sight.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said , Even thus shall the children of Israel eat their defiled bread among the Gentiles , whither I will drive them.

Then said I, Ah Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*! behold, my soul hath not been polluted : for from my youth up even till now have I not eaten of that which dieth of itself , or is torn in pieces ; neither came there abominable flesh into my mouth.
Then he said unto me, Lo , I have given thee cow’s dung for man’s dung , and thou shalt prepare thy bread therewith.

Moreover he said unto me, Son of man , behold, I will break the staff of bread in Jerusalem : and they shall eat bread by weight , and with care ; and they shall drink water by measure , and with astonishment :
That they may want bread and water , and be astonied one with another , and consume away for their iniquity.
